dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2017, the Pentagon started spending at Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty seventeen, the Pentagon started spending at Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Defense Department records show that nearly $125,000 was spent at the Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland since August 2017.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the House Oversight Committee just released documents showing over $186,000 spent there since he took office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the House Oversight Committee just released documents showing over one hundred eighty six thousand dollars spent there since he took office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Pentagon has spent at least $184,000if not moreat President Trumps Scottish resort since he took office, according to documents released by the House Oversight Committee on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and that includes nearly $127,000 just on rooms—like, around 665 nights at an average of $191 each.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and that includes nearly one hundred twenty seven thousand dollars just on rooms-like, around six hundred sixty five nights at an average of one hundred ninety one dollars each.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Defense Department records show that nearly $125,000 was spent at the Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland since August 2017. At an average cost of $189 per night, that would suggest a total of 660 individual rooms paid for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's another $61,000 that wasn't tied to travel vouchers, so it could be meals or other expenses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's another sixty one thousand dollars that wasn't tied to travel vouchers, so it could be meals or other expenses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: There was also about $60,000 spent at the resort that could not be tied to actual travel vouchers, with the Pentagons letter suggesting that it could have been used on meals and restaurants.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is uh, raising a lot of eyebrows because the resort is owned by his family.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is uh, raising a lot of eyebrows because the resort is owned by his family.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Given that Trumps family owns the resort, Democrats have criticized the number of military personnel passing through there, amid claims that Trump could potentially be profiting from spending by the Pentagon.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Democrats are saying this might violate that constitutional provision about presidents profiting from their office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Democrats are saying this might violate that constitutional provision about presidents profiting from their office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The spending figure was disclosed in a letter sent to congressional investigators, who are probing whether Trump violated a constitutional provision prohibiting presidents from enriching themselves through the office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just this—the Trump hotel in D.C. has become a hotspot for lobbyists and foreign officials too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just this-the Trump hotel in D.C. has become a hotspot for lobbyists and foreign officials too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trump hotel in Washington D.C., for instance, has become a hotspot for various lobbyists and political figures hoping to garner favor with the president.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Over 110 foreign officials from 60 countries have been spotted at Trump properties in the last two years alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Over one hundred ten foreign officials from sixty countries have been spotted at Trump properties in the last two years alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the last two years alone, at least 90 members of Congress, 250 administration officials and over 110 foreign officials from nearly 60 different countries have been seen at different Trump properties, according to a count by Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a huge number. It really blurs the line between his business and his presidency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a huge number. It really blurs the line between his business and his presidency.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the Oversight Committee is frustrated because the Pentagon's response didn't give them all the details they asked for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Oversight Committee is frustrated because the Pentagon's response didn't give them all the details they asked for.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But even with limited info, it's clear taxpayer money is flowing into his resorts way more than we knew.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But even with limited info, it's clear taxpayer money is flowing into his resorts way more than we knew.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While leaders of the Democratic House Oversight Committee voiced frustration with the limited details in the Pentagons response, it still reveals that far more taxpayer funds have been spent at the Presidents resort than previously known, they wrote back to the Pentagon on Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like a pattern at this point, you know? Mixing official duties with commercial interests.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like a pattern at this point, you know? Mixing official duties with commercial interests.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Trump has almost routinely mixed his official duties and commercial interests while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And it's not just military stops—political campaigns and orgs are spending there too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And it's not just military stops-political campaigns and orgs are spending there too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since he took office, spending at Trump properties by political candidates or organizations, including Trumps own campaign, has surged.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder how much of this is about convenience versus, um, currying favor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder how much of this is about convenience versus, um, currying favor.

artist_script:
HostA: Back in 2017, the Pentagon started spending at Trump Turnberry resort in Scotland.
HostB: Yeah, and the House Oversight Committee just released documents showing over $186,000 spent there since he took office.
HostA: Right, and that includes nearly $127,000 just on rooms—like, around 665 nights at an average of $191 each.
HostB: And then there's another $61,000 that wasn't tied to travel vouchers, so it could be meals or other expenses.
HostA: Which is uh, raising a lot of eyebrows because the resort is owned by his family.
HostB: Exactly. Democrats are saying this might violate that constitutional provision about presidents profiting from their office.
HostA: And it’s not just this—the Trump hotel in D.C. has become a hotspot for lobbyists and foreign officials too.
HostB: Over 110 foreign officials from 60 countries have been spotted at Trump properties in the last two years alone.
HostA: That’s a huge number. It really blurs the line between his business and his presidency.
HostB: And the Oversight Committee is frustrated because the Pentagon’s response didn’t give them all the details they asked for.
HostA: But even with limited info, it’s clear taxpayer money is flowing into his resorts way more than we knew.
HostB: It feels like a pattern at this point, you know? Mixing official duties with commercial interests.
HostA: Absolutely. And it’s not just military stops—political campaigns and orgs are spending there too.
HostB: Makes you wonder how much of this is about convenience versus, um, currying favor.
